newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIA'S PUNJAB COTTON FIRMER, GUJARAT STEADY.
newsitem.headline: INDIA'S PUNJAB COTTON FIRMER, GUJARAT STEADY.

text.p: Punjab cotton moved up while Gujarat varieties remained steady on the local market, dealer said.
Punjab cotton rose on the back of speculative buying supported by lower supplies and a shortage of ready stock at the tail-end of the season.
In spot deals Bengal-deshi rose by 10/30 rupees at 1,060/1,120 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while traders were offering October delivery at 1,040/1,060 rupees per maund.
Meanwhile, Punjab saw-ginned in spot deals rose by 10/20 rupees to 1,830/1,875 rupees per maund and F-414 rose by 10 rupees to 2,070/2,090 per maund.

Gujarat cotton kept to a narrow range and finished on a quiet note amid limited activity. Gujarat Kalyan was steady at 14,200/14,700 rupees per candy (355.56 kg), as was wagad cotton at 13,000/13,200 rupees and Kala-ginned at 12,300/12,400 rupees per candy.
